key_channel_insights.line_content: Philippine Airlines experienced 92% unavailability of offers on OTA channels, representing potential inefficiencies in distribution.
The MSE channel offered 62% of fares at lower prices than the airline's website, showcasing its competitive edge.
GDS channel reports consistently higher prices compared to the airline's website, indicating a premium for agency bookings.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: For Philippine Airlines on OTAs, 92% of offers were not found last week, indicating high unavailability.
7.76% of the offers were priced the same on both the airline's website and OTAs last week, showing stable alignment in a minor portion.
Only 0.20% of offers were lower-priced on OTAs than on the airline's website last week, a minor share indicating competitive pricing is rare.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: A consistent high share (~91%) of website offers were not found on OTAs across the latest week, previous week, and past month.
Stable price parity at around 8% last week, with a slight decline compared to the previous month.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: 97% of short haul offers were not available on OTAs last week, maintaining trend consistency.
50% of long haul offers were not available, with a slight decline from the previous week.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: All Philippines-origin offers were consistently unavailable on OTAs, suggesting a focus on direct sales channels.
Non-Philippine origin offer absence on OTAs decreased slightly to 3.5%, indicating mild improvement in visibility.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Approximately 91% of close-in booking offers unavailable on OTAs, with slight reduction in alignment with longer booking windows trends.
OTA availability rates for far-out bookings show a potential improvement with over 90% absent but trends slightly more positive than close-in.

mse_highlights.line_content: The MSE channel consistently offers lower prices than the airline's website, with 62% of offers being lower last week.
Instances where MSE prices matched the airline website increased slightly by 4.42% from the previous week.
The price divergence between the MSE channel and airline site narrowed over the past month, with channel prices decreasing further.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Pricing in MSE was predominantly lower than the airline's own site with a -0.11% price difference last week.
There was a 4.42% rise in parity where MSE's prices matched the airline's web pricing compared to the previous week.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 62% of short-haul fares were lower on MSE than on the website, with a week-over-week decrease of -4.62% in lower offers.
Virtually all long-haul prices remained lower on MSE, with no significant changes in pricing trends from the past month.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Nearly 59% of fares for journeys originating in PH were lower on MSE, though this figure slightly decreased compared to the previous month.
Non-PH origins had 98% lower prices on MSE, with monthly dips in differences indicating increasing competitiveness.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in booking offers were 71% lower on MSE, decreasing 4.67% from the prior week, indicating dynamic pricing adjustments.
Prices for far-out bookings were lower on MSE with a notable decrease in price differences by 9.11% over the past month.

gds_highlights.line_content: A small proportion of flights channel-wide were not available on the GDS, with frequencies remaining stable except a slight decline from past month.
Majority of the offers on the GDS channel are priced higher than on PR's website, consistent from past weeks and months.
Price parity occurrences between GDS and PR's website have slightly decreased recently, maintaining a level difference percentage of 0%.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Minimal fluctuation in website-exclusive pricing offers, indicating stability in content distribution strategy.
Consistency in price parity with a slight decrease, implying persistent competition between channels.
GDS consistently higher-priced, suggesting a premium charged for agency bookings.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: On short-haul, 78.2% of offers are higher-priced on GDS, highlighting a trend towards premium short-haul pricing via agencies.
Long-haul flights exhibit less price volatility with a stable split between higher and same pricing.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Offers originating in the Philippines are mostly higher on GDS, indicating potential domestic market influencers.
Non-PH origins mainly maintain same pricing across comparatives, underscoring consistent international strategies.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings are predominantly priced higher on GDS, possibly due to urgent business traveler trends.
Far-out booking windows exhibit steady same or higher pricing trends, reflective of strategic advance purchase dynamics.
